msContents.summary: F-xxx: Miracles of Mary, Tä’ammǝrä Maryam, ተአምረ፡ ማርያም፡, for Monday through Saturday, written in Ge'ez (left column) and Amharic (right columns). The standard works on the miracles of Mary are Cerulli, Maria, and Budge, Mary. An exhaustive collection has been published in Ethiopia, Tä’ammǝrä Maryam (Addis Ababa: Tǝnśa’e zä-guba’e, 1989 E.C.) EMML 2058, 2059, and 2060. See Delamarter, et al, MYS 1 for a description of 371 miracles. F-8r: Hymn to Mary, “I Prostrate Before You,” እሰግድ፡ ለኪ፡. Répertoire 336/338. F-18v: the Introductory Rite from Mu‘älläqa, in Ge'ez (left) and Amharic (right). F-20v: How the Virgin Mary saved a harlot from stoning by the people of a certain city (TM, p. 121), in Ge'ez (left) and Amharic (right). Further Miracles (f, 23r, 25r, 27r, ), in Ge'ez (left) and Amharic (right). F-xxx: Vision of John, Son of Thunder, on the Agreement of the Eighty-One Canonical Scriptures. For a critical edition and English translation, see Getatchew Haile, The Mariology of Emperor Zär’a Ya‘ǝqob of Ethiopia, OCA 242 (Rome: Pontificium Institutum Studiorum Orientalium, 1992), esp. 94–117. F-xxx: Collection of Biblical Confessions gathered by two monks from Dabra Bizan. On the religious controversy. F. i v-iii r: Magabit 7, 1941. Record, a Will by ቄስ ፍሰሀ በለጡ, in which he specifies who should receive which properties. At the end are five finger prints with signatures of each witness. Written in Amharic. F and passim mention the owner, መምሕር ፍሥሐ ጽዮን. has a colophon: This book was written in Dabra Bizan, the monastery named by Philipos and John. . .in 1900 EC. . .in the year of John the Evangelist,on Monday, on the 5th day of Miyazia, at 3 in the afternoon. . . by scribe ወልደ ጻድቅ.
